intro: Larnastyra claytonii, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula larnastyra, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Western Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense cluster, typically blooming during the late spring and early summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species.
